description.narrative: 2.3 Communities have increased capacities and commitment to use basic sanitation facilities and demonstrate improved hygiene and sanitation practices and behaviors, particularly in UNICEF-targeted districts., which contributes to Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Disaster Risk Reduction, Sanitation, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, more children and their families, particularly in rural and poor urban areas, have access to and use affordable and sustainable basic water and sanitation services, and practices safe hygiene behaviors

COMMUNITY ORGANISATION FOR DEVELOPM AND EMPOWERMENT SIERRA LEONE
MOVEMENT TOWARDS PEACE AND DEVELOPM AGENCY SIERRA LEONE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.3 Communities have increased capacities and commitment to use basic sanitation facilities and demonstrate improved hygiene and sanitation practices and behaviors, particularly in UNICEF-targeted districts.
Number of additional people living in the newly certified Open Defecation Free (ODF) communities as a result of UNICEF CATS programming during the year of reporting
Number of schools that practice daily group handwashing in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support and/or leveraged through national programmes
Number of men and women, girls and boys, who gained access to basic sanitation services in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support
Number of people reached in hygiene promotion campaign with increased accessibility to hand washing with soap.
